data.title: 46th Annual Museum Mile Festival @ Jewish Museum
data.meta_description: Join the Jewish Museum and our Museum Mile neighbors for the 46th Annual Museum Mile Festival. Attendees can walk on Fifth Avenue between 82nd Street and 110th Street and visit eight of New York City’s finest cultural institutions, all of which are free and open...
data.text:
Join the Jewish Museum and our Museum Mile neighbors for the 46th Annual Museum Mile Festival. Attendees can walk on Fifth Avenue between 82nd Street and 110th Street and visit eight of New York City’s finest cultural institutions, all of which are free and open to the public from 6 to 9 pm.

The institutions participating this year are: The Metropolitan Museum of Art; Neue Galerie New York; Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum; Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum; The Jewish Museum; Museum of the City of New York; El Museo del Barrio; and The Africa Center. Additional programming will be presented by: The Asia Society; Church of the Heavenly Rest; AKC Museum of the Dog; New York Academy of Medicine; and 92NY. Please check each venue’s website to learn more about their programming, which will include musical performances and activities for families and adults.

At the Jewish Museum:

LIVE MUSIC

A musical performance by Matt Darieu World Klezmer Kapelye (three sets at 6 pm, 7 pm, and 8 pm), presented as part of our ongoing collaboration with Bang on a Can, will take place outside the Jewish Museum on Fifth Avenue.

DROP-IN ART ACTIVITY

Inspired by the vivid artworks in the exhibition Overflow, Afterglow: New Work in Chromatic Figuration, create a collage depicting figures in an imaginative and colorful environment.

EXHIBITIONS ON VIEW

Overflow, Afterglow: New Work in Chromatic Figuration

Frederick Kiesler: Vision Machines

Free; No advance registration required

Location:
